item.title: Nix for Python, attempt number 2
item.description: Last post we tried to make a Python project fully reproducible based on a detailed requirements.txt file. We ended up not managing to go the full Nix way, but we got pretty close. However, there are many ways to approach this, with language-specific tools getting published and archived on the regular. At the end of the last post I mentioned dream2nix and their “Build your Python project in 10 minutes” tutorial which I would try out in a future post.

item.title: Nix for Python, attempt number 1
item.description: Disclaimer: This is less of a tutorial and more of a record of my past experience—in particular, I end up not reaching my stated goal for this post. I’ve been reading this book on Hypermedia Systems, and one of the things they do is develop a small CRUD application in Python for which the code can be found here. Like the good software citizens they are, they’ve included a full detailed list of their project dependencies as a requirements.
